documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that 's it from the bbc local live team for the week .
please join us again from 08:00 on monday for more news , sport , travel and weather updates for coventry and warwickshire .
keep an eye out here for breaking news before then .

documents.title: coventry bees ride again
text: coventry bees speedway supporters are expected to head to peterborough in numbers this weekend .
the full bees line up will race in a challenge meeting against the pirates in a match arranged by the save coventry speedway campaign .
the bees have been expelled from this season 's premiership due to the lack of a home track .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: become a digital guru - apply now for a bbc apprenticeship
text: have you got what it takes to make a story go viral ?
news is looking to recruit digital apprentices ' across the country , including wolverhampton .
you have until 18 april to apply .
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crowds support ring road poetry event
text: an event celebrating coventry 's ring road with a series of films and verse attracted a crowd of more than 250 at fargo last night , organisers say .

lead artist adam steiner said he hoped the project , disappear here , had `` changed a few hearts and minds '' about what poetry is and that the ring road had proved a `` definitive source of inspiration for audiences and artists alike '' .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coleshill town 's bid for a wembley final place
text: coleshill town 's players are in south shields to prepare for tomorrow 's fa vase semi-final .
they go into the second leg needing to overturn a 2-1 deficit to secure a place at the wembley final .
looks like it 's a bit chilly up there !
bring on tomorrow
good luck x
flippin cold
cold ?
was a warm day today # welcometothenortheast # godscountry
enjoy your weekend lads .
cold ? ? ?
shorts and tee shirt weather !
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: weather : rain this evening and tomorrow
text: we 're forecast more rain this evening and tomorrow , so you might want to celebrate st patrick 's day indoors - or take an umbrella .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: disruption continues between coventry and nuneaton
text: a broken down train between coventry and nuneaton means buses are replacing trains between these stations , the network rail website says .
disruption is expected to continue until approximately 18:45 .

documents.title: meet the cycling jewel thieves
text: meet the cycling jewel thieves

documents.title: sky blues : ivor lawton to stay on
text: sky blues midfielder ivor lawton is to be given the chance to prove himself after asking to stay at the club .
the 21-year-old had been told by previous manager russell slade to look for a new club , but new boss mark robins says he 's agreed to have lawton back .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: big wheel 's arrival gets residents in a spin
text: despite widespread angry reaction from residents and businesses opposed to the observation wheel 's location in swan 's nest lane , jan de koning , director of de koning leisure group ltd told the herald .
the wheel is due to open to the public on 1st april .
author: Stratford Herald

documents.title: pool reopens in bedworth after coach crash
text: swimming at bedworth leisure centre is expected to return to normal from 15:30 today after the pool 's temporary closure due to a coach crash .
the borough council says the damage has been fixed , and are ready to fully reopen the site .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: travel : two lanes closed on m6
text: long queues towards junction 2 ( m69 ) from junction 1 ( a426 ) on ther m6 .
2 lanes closed after an accident

documents.title: travel : traffic released on m6 northbound
text: one lane has now reopened on the m6 northbound between junctions one and two , to release traffic says highways england .
traffic released with 2 lanes ( of 3 ) clsd # m6 n/b btwn j1 + j2 whilst @ twitterid clear a fuel spill .
long delays on approach , plan ahead

documents.title: two-car collision closes m6 northbound
text: a two-car collision and fuel spillage has closed all lanes of the m6 northbound between j1 , a426 ( rugby ) and j2 , m69 ( coventry ) .
traffic is held # m6 n/b btwn j1 + j2 due to a 2 car collision and fuel spill .
@ twitterid + @ twitterid on scene , delays building .

documents.title: travel : bus replacement service between coventry and nuneaton
text: a faulty train is causing delays and cancellations to services running between coventry and nuneaton , says london midland .
there are buses running between the stations .
road transport will be in operation from nuneaton at 14.50hrs and from coventry at 15.15hrs
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch leamington 's falcons nesting on town hall
text: a live feed showing falcons nesting in central leamington spa has been set up in a partnership between warwickshire wildlife trust and the district council .
we have a # peregrinefalcon nesting in the tower at the town hall and we 've set up a webcam to watch it live !
great idea !
please can we have webcams at st nics and newbold as well so we can see the work progressing ?
we are currently in the process of doing just that !
watch this space
fantastic !
excited to hear that
is this the 1st nest at the town hall ?
we believe they have been nesting for several years , and last year they raised three chicks from the tower .
i couldnt recall if they had or not .
im sure the local bird population was pleased as punch for them
@ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: coventry 'one of the uk 's fastest-moving property markets '
text: coventry is listed as being in the top ten property hotspots in britain by the website zoopla .
the search portal looked at the ty length of time between a home going up for sale on its site .
and the listing changing to `` under offer '' in 50 large towns and cities outside london .
coventry properties came in at eighth fastest at 35 days , compared to a country-wide average of 42 .
northampton performed best at 27 days , and properties in wales sitting on the market for the longest length of time , around 66 days .

documents.title: two charged following nuneaton assault
text: two men have been arrested and charged after an incident in cedar road , nuneaton on wednesday , police say .
both have been charged with grievous bodily harm and two counts of criminal damage to property .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: electoral fraud claims : two interviewed
text: evidence relating to electoral fraud allegations could be handed over to the crown prosecution service ( cps ) shortly , warwickshire police says .
twelve police forces have submitted reports to the cps .
relating to the use of the conservative `` battle bus '' , and how it was recorded in campaign spending returns during the 2015 general election .
two people have been interviewed as part of the inquiry , police said .

documents.title: coventry half marathon : road closures
text: roads around coventry 's half marathon route will start closing from 09:00 on sunday .
you can find a list of them here .

documents.title: thousands of homes set for kenilworth
text: on our front page this week : thousands of homes still set for kenilworth , you can find more stories on our website .
author: Kenilworth Weekly News

documents.title: asian councillor 'racially abused ' sri lankan shopkeeper
text: a coventry city councillor is facing an ethics committee hearing following complaints by foleshill shopkeeper nagarajah kuruparan .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: jordan willis in contention for sky blues trip to milton keynes
text: sky blues manager mark robins is expected to make changes to his team for tomorrow 's trip to the mk dons as he assesses his squad .
defender jordan willis is in contention to a return after being sidelined by injury .
the team is 17 points from safety , with nine games to go .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: man with cocaine and stolen petrol in high speed police chase on coventry ring road
text: a man with cocaine and stolen petrol in his car led the police on a high-speed chase around coventry before breaking down in the outside lane of the ring road and making off on foot .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: metro mayor candidate 'will re-open old railway lines '
text: improving public transport in the west midlands is the top priority for former john lewis managing director andy street as he ramps up his fight to become the region 's new mayor .
the new mayor will be responsible for housing , transport and job creation , but andy street says his focus will also be on getting us from a to b more quickly .
we will re-open disused railway lines , like from moseley to new street , and then across the black country from stourbridge to walsall .
we are also talking about building the tram network across the whole conurbation and with buses we 're talking about dedicated lanes and cleaner vehicles
author: Amy Cole
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: man reportedly performs lewd act in front of teenage girl in leamington
text: warwickshire police are appealing for witnesses after a man reportedly performed a lewd act in front of a teenage girl in leamington .
author: Leamington Courier

documents.title: hundreds line up for coventry half marathon
text: around 3,500 runners are expected to take part in sunday 's coventry half marathon , organisers say .
the number is down on last year 's event , .
when more than 4,200 completed the course , but registration for the race only opened in december after the previous organisers withdrew .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: £ 14m bid to transform nuneaton town centre
text: a bid has been made for £ 14m from a multi-million pound pot to transform nuneaton town centre .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: wasps trio in line-up for six nations
text: the wasps trio of james haskell , elliot daly and joe launchbury have retained their places in the england side for saturday 's six nations match against ireland .
but club-mate nathan hughes drops to the bench with billy vunipola taking the number eight jersey and anthony watson also restored to the starting fifteen .
coventry-born tom wood is expected to earn his 50th cap as england look to complete the grand slam .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: travel : all lanes re-open on a46
text: all lanes have now re-opened on the a46 between stoneleigh and coventry on the northbound carriageway , after a lorry shed it 's frozen chicken load earlier .
recovery and clean-up complete , closure lifted # a46 n/b btwn # a452 + # a45 near # warwickshire .
have a safe journey .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: tailbacks as lorry sheds frozen chickens
text: a shed load of frozen chickens has closed two lanes of the a46 between stoneleigh and coventry on the northbound carriageway .
highways england expect the clean-up operation , between the a452 and festival island , to carry on for another couple of hours .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

please join us again from 08:00 on friday for more news , sport , travel and weather updates .
keep an eye out here for breaking news before then .

documents.title: more fly-tipping reported in north warwickshire
text: more fly-tipping has been reported to the council in north warwickshire , this time in packington lane coleshill .
the council is reminding residents that incidents , including rubbish , fly-posting and graffiti can be reported to them via its online service .
more fly tipping in packington lane coleshill .
reported to the council via fix my street app

documents.title: hit-and-run victim 'may have been assaulted ' beforehand
text: a pedestrian , who was hit by a van in cedar road , nuneaton , yesterday , may have been assaulted by the occupants of the vehicle before the collision , say police .

a man in his 20s was taken to hospital after being hit by the ford transit which then went on to collide with a wall outside camp hill sports centre , and was later found abandoned in laburnum grove .
det sgt carl buckley of nuneaton cid says it 's thought the victim and offenders may be known to each other .
it happened at about 16:30 .

documents.title: the ring road that inspires odes
text: the ring road that inspires odes

documents.title: school report : coventry quizzed about bullying issues
text: our intrepid school reporters from higham lane school in nuneaton are exploring issues around mental health and well-being ; putting together a report on cyber-bullying .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: weather : rain overnight and into tomorrow
text: we 're going to have some rain moving in from the north overnight and there could be some showers tomorrow too .
check out the latest forecast for your area .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: official opening of tollbar end
text: a three-year scheme to improve the tollbar end junction to the south east of coventry officially ends today with a ceremonial opening of the site .
the £ 106m project included the widening of the a45 stonebrige highway and enlarging the tollbar roundabout allowing traffic to flow along an underpass between the a46 eastern bypass and the a45 .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: woman accused of making threatening calls to nurseries
text: a woman , 22 , has appeared in court charged with making threatening phone calls to nurseries and schools across the west midlands .
rebecca cooper , of parkhill street , dudley , is accused of making the calls yesterday .
she appeared before magistrates in dudley charged with eight counts of malicious communications and a further charge of racially-aggravated behaviour towards a police officer .

the allegations in part are in connection with an incident at abc nursery in rochester road , earlsdon , coventry , yesterday during which staff oversaw an evacuation of the premises which remained in place for four hours .

documents.title: wasps ' frank halai to join pau next season
text: wasps rugby have confirmed winger frank halai will leave in the summer to join french side pau next season after two years with the club .
halai , who was capped by the all blacks in 2013 , joined wasps from the auckland blues and said he 'll be doing his best for the premiership side for the remainder of the season .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: school report : coventry pupils take part
text: zyisha from blue coat school is among a group from coventry working out of the london newsroom today for bbc school report .
you may even catch them on the one show later .
live : on route to @ twitterid @ twitterid studios to be part of a live streamed mental health special from radio theatre !
@ twitterid reppin !
love this !
ca n't think of a better group to represent and speak out !
yes yes !
hey fantastic !
could you dm me the pupil 's name and school - vanessa

documents.title: presenters deny having sex against tree in view of boys
text: a married couple who have presented for bbc radio deny outraging public decency over allegations they had sex against a tree in front of a group of boys .
tony and julie wadsworth , aged 69 and 59 respectively , have today also pleaded not guilty to multiple charges of indecent assault against seven boys .
the offences of which they are accused are alleged to have been committed during a seven-year period in the 1990s .
julie wadsworth , who uses the name mayer on air , pleaded not guilty to five counts of outraging public decency and not guilty to 12 charges of indecent assault .
mr wadsworth also denies outraging public decency and has pleaded not guilty to 10 charges of indecent assault in which he allegedly `` kept watch '' for his wife during her alleged assaults .
at warwick crown court earlier , a trial for the pair , of broughton astley , leicestershire , who have been granted bail , was set for may .
they have presented for bbc wm in birmingham , bbc coventry and warwickshire , and bbc radio leicester .

documents.title: ex-garage boss held up coventry post office with fake gun
text: a man whose car body repair business was failing because of his drinking drove to his local post office in his works van and tried to hold up the sub-postmaster with a fake gun .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: regions share £ 20m lottery culture fund
text: regions share £ 20m lottery culture fund

documents.title: breakingbbc presenters plead not guilty to sex offences against boys
text: two bbc presenters have pleaded not guilty in connection with a string of sex offences against seven boys under the age of 18 .
tony wadsworth , 69 , of old mill road , broughton astley , leicestershire , and his 59-year-old wife julie , of the same address , appeared at warwick crown court to enter their pleas .
the offences are alleged to have taken place between july 1992 and august 1999 .
the pair had broadcast for bbc wm in birmingham , bbc coventry and warwickshire , and bbc radio leicester .

documents.title: travel : trespassers delay rail services
text: trespassers on the railway lines between coventry and nuneaton mean services are running at reduced speed , says london midland .
due to trespassers on the railway between coventry and nuneaton trains have to run at reduced speed on all lines .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: coventry scoops £ 1.5m to boost arts , culture and heritage
text: funding worth £ 1.5m has been awarded to the trust overseeing coventry 's bid to become city of culture 2021 .
the heritage lottery fund and arts council england cash - for coventry city of culture trust - is to boost arts , culture and heritage schemes in the city , the trust says .
the city becomes one of only 16 places to secure the funding over three years as part of the great place scheme .
a programme of projects includes a major new arts commission for coventry cathedral and a number of city centre festivals .

documents.title: police free dog left in hot car
text: police smashed a window to free a dog locked in a hot car parked at a branch of mcdonald 's .
it happened in bassetts pole where birmingham meets staffordshire and warwickshire .

the small dog had been left in the unattended vehicle with all the windows closed , parked in direct sunlight , at about 12:30 yesterday , said warwickshire police which was alerted by a member of the public .
the owner , found in a nearby business , was cautioned and reported for the offence of causing an animal unnecessary suffering .

documents.title: rfu will have to agree finances with premiership clubs
text: the rugby football union will have to agree a financial settlement with wasps rugby and the premiership clubs before arranging a fixture with world champions new zealand this november .
the rfu has .
opened negotiations over a match .
in the autumn , which would be outside the international window .
it is understood the premiership clubs would have to give permission for the release of their players .
the match is not a formal part of the .
£ 225m agreement with the rfu .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: bed-blocking in warwickshire rockets
text: on our front page this week : calls for action on bed-blocking crisis .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: bedworth pool remains closed after bus crash
text: the pool at bedworth leisure centre remains closed today after a coach crashed into the building , which had to be sealed-off .
the borough councillor in charge of the site , ian lloyd , said engineers worked into the night to make the building safe , but the pool area would remain closed .
the driver of the bus was treated at the scene and suffered only minor injuries , said the ambulance service .

documents.title: boy , 12 , robs woman at knifepoint
text: boy , 12 , robs woman at knifepoint

documents.title: woman cut free from car after crash with tree and wall
text: a woman in her 70s had to be cut from her car after it collided with a wall and a tree in lillington .

the ambulance service says it was called to the site at the junction of lime avenue and cedar close at about 16:40 yesterday , and the woman was taken to hospital suffering neck and back pain as well as cuts to the head .
crews from leamington and kenilworth attended an rtc on lime avenue in lillington this evening .
one person was released from her vehicle .
wow !
i always think lime avenue is so quiet !

documents.title: council threatened to make coventry city play behind closed doors
text: coventry city were at risk of being forced to play behind closed doors by coventry city council , after safety fears were raised in relation to matchday stewarding at the ricoh arena .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: woman robbed at knife-point by '12 year old '
text: a woman was robbed at knife-point by a boy aged about 12 years old as she walked her dog in henley-in-arden , police say .

during yesterday 's robbery , which happened at about 17:00 on tuesday , the child demanded money and jewellery from the woman in her 60s , who handed over her jewellery before the offender ran off in the direction of beaudesert place .
investigating officer det insp teresa mckenna of warwickshire police said `` incidents of this nature are very rare '' .
the victim , who was walking in beaudesert lane , was uninjured and police say they 'll be patrolling the area .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video : where 's the sunshine gone ?
text: not as nice as yesterday , with some fog around first thing , then a cloudy day with the potential for drizzle later on with highs of 11c ( 52f ) .
you can find a full forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: scrap material dome built on country estate
text: compton verney is an 18th century mansion house with gardens designed by capability brown .
welcome to the geo-dome , known as the clearing - this is a sign of what life could be like in the future .
inside there 's a bed , a log burner and small kitchen , which are all made using recycled materials .
it 's all hand-built using scrap materials .

this was built in response to an eye catcher on the landscape , capability brown used to build follies in the landscape which were talking points for people and would focus their attention on the landscape .
what is better than the talking point of climate change , in this day and age and what 's happening to the world ? ''
you can see more on this story on midlands today on bbc one at 18:30 .
author: Joan Cummins
Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: school bus crashes into leisure centre
text: a school bus has demolished a wall at bedworth leisure centre , causing swimming pool water to flood out .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: watch : a clear night ahead but turning cloudy tomorrow
text: it will be a clear and settled start to the evening .
it will feel cool under clear skies , allowing areas of fog to develop through the early hours .
however , it should remain dry for most - lows of 4c ( 39f ) .
tomorrow will be much cloudier , with outbreaks of light rain expected through the afternoon .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: police one of six for forces to use response belt
text: warwickshire police is one of six forces in the uk who continue to use emergency response belts to help control offenders .
yesterday , a police sergeant and two detention officers were cleared of killing a man in custody after one was placed around his face .
officers use the belts as a limb restraint or carrying aid , but do n't use them on heads .
west midlands police say they 've never used the belts .
news explains how the restraint belts are used in the uk .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: dog walker held at knifepoint by young boy
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a dog walker was held at knifepoint by a young boy .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: let 's find coventry and warwickshire 's most unloved dog a new home
text: is this coventry and warwickshire 's most un-loved dog ?
meet rudi - he 's featured throughout various online , newspaper and radio appeals to find him a home .
we shared his story two weeks ago .
- which gained lots of interest on social media , but the charity says no one has come forward .
rudi has been in the care of the dogs trust at kenilworth since 2014 and is its longest serving resident .
rudi , who is eight-years-old , is said to have `` a real zest for life '' and is happy with his own company .
his simple list of requirements include :
do n't be rude - give rudi the rover a home .
he 's @ twitterid kenilworth 's longest serving resident
we love rudi !
but would love him to find a forever home even more
met rudi at kenilworth , he 's a lovely lad , you should go see him
author: Stephanie Barnard
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coventry bears left 'bruised '
text: coventry bears boss tom tsang said his side are .
`` bruised but buoyant '' after tasting a heavy 50-14 defeat at home to barrow in the kingstone press league one .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: mystery handmade dome built on country estate
text: a giant dome has sprung up in the grounds of a stately home in warwickshire as part of a thought-provoking new art project .
the clearing .
at compton verney aims to give to visitors a glimpse of a world where the economy has collapsed and fossil fuels have run out .
author: Joan Cummins
Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: man arrested in connection with robbery
text: a man has been arrested in connection with a robbery in warwick .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: protest at bmw over closure of car maker 's final salary pension scheme
text: bmw workers are staging a protest outside the hams hall engine plant in coleshill against the car maker 's plans to close their final salary pension scheme .
it follows figures from the company last week showing a surge in net profits and sales .
simon powell , from the unite union , said workers `` deserved better '' .
bmw says it is very proud of its excellent pension provision in the past but they want to protect pension provision for the future .
author: Sarah Bishop
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: bedworth leisure centre forced to close after coach collision drama
text: a leisure centre has been forced to close after a coach careered into the side of the building causing pool water to gush out of the wreckage .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: 'to poo or not to poo , that is the question ? ' - dog fouling crackdown near bard 's grave
text: the mayor of stratford says new bylaws need to be introduced to crackdown on an increase in the amount of dog-fouling in the town .
the graveyard of holy trinity church , where william shakespeare is buried , is said to be one of the worst affected areas .
we 're looking very seriously at putting some bylaws in place .
we 've had so many complaints that we 're taking it very , very seriously . ''

documents.title: furore as 'heavy handed ' wasps security take charge of coventry city 's stewards
text: ricoh arena owners wasps have taken charge of matchday security and control of coventry city 's stewards for sky blues games - leading to further tension between the stadium 's owners , its tenant and football fans , we have learned .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: drivers caught using mobile phones while driving
text: a driver was caught accessing online banking on his phone while on the m5 , while holding a bank statement in his other hand .
a driving instructor was also fined for using a mobile while he had a learner in his car , west midlands police said .
on 1 march , penalties for drivers caught using a phone doubled to six points and a £ 200 fine .
in a week-long police clampdown 261 distracted drivers were caught .
it 's shocking so many hgv drivers were among those we caught .
these are professional drivers , ones who should be setting high standards , yet we found 30 truckers phoning , texting or using the internet while driving . ''

documents.title: man seriously injured in crash
text: a driver has been seriously injured in a crash in kenilworth last night .
the 55-year-old man sustained a head injury and a number of fractures .
he was cut free from his vehicle after two cars collided at the junction of leamington road and bullimore grove .
the other driver of the car , a 41-year-old man , is said to have suffered relatively minor injuries .
author: Martin Winch
BBC Local Live

documents.title: couple overwhelmed by support for upcoming fundraiser
text: a couple from warwick who are on a fundraising bid to thank hospital staff have been overwhelmed by people 's generosity and support .
author: Warwick Courier

documents.title: sport headlines : sky blues ' 'horredous ' night at southend ; new signing for coventry rugby
text: our top sport stories we 're looking at include :
- `` horrendous '' - that 's how manager mark robins described the sky blues ' performance last night , losing 2-0 away to southend
- coventry rugby have signed nottingham prop harry morley for next season
- the queen mother champion chase is the feature race on ladies day at cheltenham - follow coverage on bbc sport
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: father to plead for better brain tumour treatment after his son died
text: a father from rugby is going to westminster today to campaign for better research into the diagnosis and treatment of brain tumours .
peter ralf started a campaign for improvements after his son , stephen , died from a brain tumour in 2014 , aged 26 .
a year after stephen 's death , his sister maria and his father .
started an online petiion which raised more than 120,000 signatures .
the pair are due to speak at a parliamentary select committee later on the issue .
today is a chance for the brain tumour community to meet with mps and talk to people about how we 're going to go forward .
so little progress has been made in the last 30 years i think it 's almost a question of going back to basics and just trying to establish what causes brain tumours in the first place . ''
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: domestic abuse services given a £ 60,000 boost
text: services to help victims of domestic abuse from becoming re-victimised have been given a £ 60,000 boost by warwickshire 's police and crime commissioner .
author: Stratford Herald

documents.title: unemployment up 9,000 in west midlands in latest figures
text: unemployment in the west midlands rose by 9,000 to 160,000 in the three months to january , official figures show .
they show the region saw the joint-largest jobless increase compared with the rest of the country - five other areas also saw rises .
it means the current unemployment rate in the west midlands is 5.6 % , the office for national statistics said .
that compares with the uk unemployment rate falling to 4.7 % , its lowest rate in 41 years in the three months to january .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: league two looms for sky blues
text: if ever there was a photo to summarise a game , this is it .
here 's coventry city 's callum reilly after the final whistle following their 2-0 defeat to southend .
relegation to league two looms even larger on the horizon for the sky blues .
`` horrendous '' - that 's how manager mark robins described the performance and added that the players have to `` find it in themselves '' .

documents.title: two men taken to hospital after kenilworth crash
text: two men were taken to hospital after a two-car crash in kenilworth yesterday evening .
author: Warwick Courier

documents.title: m40 delays following crash
text: drivers are being warned to expect delays on the m40 at stratford-upon-avon after a crash at the j15 roundabout .
traffic on the a46 is also being affected by delays .
1 lane closed # m40 j15 roundabout due to a collision involving 2 cars .
recovery are on scene .
long delays on approach # m40 s/b + # a46 .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: online id fraud on the rise
text: our top story this morning : identity fraud in the west midlands has reached record levels , according to the credit industry fraud avoidance service .
the organisation says the crime has risen by 17 % in the last year to more than 11,300 cases .
id theft now represents over half of all fraud the organisation records , with most happening online .
author: Martin Winch
BBC Coventry and Warwickshire

documents.title: delays on trains between birmingham and coventry due to emergency incident
text: rail services between birmingham new street and coventry are subject to delays and cancellations this morning after emergency services were called out to stechford , after reports .
someone had been hit by a train .
all lines have now re-opened , but london midland and virgin west coast are warning passengers of ongoing delays and short notice cancellations .
sorry for the delay david .
it was down to a suspected person being hit by at train at stechford .
^sb
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: ambulance service confirms twitter hack
text: west midlands ambulance service has confirmed its twitter account was hacked this morning .
the tweet which went up at around 07:00 carried text supporting the turkish president recep tayyip erdogan who is in a feud with germany and the netherlands .
the post was deleted shortly afterwards .
the ambulance service says it 's now removed the post and changed its passwords and security settings .

other twitter accounts also appeared to have been hacked overnight including the bbc north america account which tweeted at : `` hi everyone - we temporarily lost control of this account , but normal service has resumed .
thanks . ''
hi everyone - we temporarily lost control of this account , but normal service has resumed .
thanks .
that would explain this
@ twitterid @ twitterid having temporarily lost control of the country will normal service be resumed there too # trump
@ twitterid has been hacked too - you got same password or something ? ? ! !
@ twitterid
terrible-glad you recovered .
uh k ?
author: Phil Bowers
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: bmw staff strike over pension plan
text: bmw workers will protest outside the hams hall engine plant in warwickshire today over the car maker 's plans to close their final salary pension scheme .
figures last week from the company showed a surge in net profit and sales .
union members believe the move could see some of the firm 's uk workforce lose up to £ 160,000 in retirement income .
bmw is yet to comment .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : a dry and bright day ahead
text: skies will be partly cloudy today with some sunny spells at times .
it will stay dry through the day and it will feel mild in the sunshine and light winds - highs of 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: wednesday : live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: welcome to wednesday .
looking like a fine day with not too much cloud lingering .
we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can .
email , .
tweet us .
or message via .
facebook .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: coventry city 0-2 southend united
text: coventry city 0-2 southend united

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that 's all from us on tuesday - we 're back from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: more fly-tipped rubbish in north warwickshire
text: fly-tipped rubbish has been dumped at whitehouse farm lane in nether whitacre , says north warwickshire borough council .
the cost of cleaning up fly-tipping across the west midlands reached £ 3m last year .
last week , conservative mp for north warwickshire , craig tracey , told the commons it was `` unacceptable '' and the problem was each year causing the local council around £ 650,000 .
more rubbish !
whitehouse farm lane , nether whitacre .
did you see anything ?
report it 01827 715341 - help catch the culprits !
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crash injury amid police pursuit
text: a motorcyclist was injured during a police chase in nuneaton today , close to the quarry on tuttle hill .
officers say they were in pursuit of an audi believed to be driven by a man wanted in connection with a number of serious offences .
according to the warwickshire force , during the course of the operation , a collision occured between a renault clio and a suzuki motorbike .
the motorcyclist suffered cuts to his leg and was taken to hospital .
the force 's professional standards department will be informed .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cash stolen in post office raid
text: cash was stolen during a robbery at a post office in warwick today , police say .
a man demanded money from staff at the counter in shire hall at about 09:00 and made off with an unknown quantity .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lorry crash leaves car suspended on barrier
text: a car ended up sideways on the concrete barrier of the ring road in coventry today after a collision with a lorry .
ambulance service staff say the driver escaped with just minor injuries following the crash which left her facing the wrong way on the ringway .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coventry mosque leader stabbed child with pen and beat other youngsters
text: a religious leader at a coventry mosque beat children aged as young as nine - including stabbing one with a pen .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: politics of marriage and divorce
text: politics of marriage and divorce
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: donor found for nuneaton leukemia patient
text: the parents of a leukemia patient from nuneaton say a bone marrow donor has been found , allowing an operation later this month .
kacper goldiszewicz , seven , from nuneaton , had been undergoing chemotherapy at birmingham children 's hospital and has now started treatment for the transplant on 22 march .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: collision involving car and lorry in coventry
text: police are at the scene of a collision involving a car and lorry at the junction of sky blue way and far gosford street in coventry .
the ambulance service says it 's on its way and one occupant of the car is thought to have been injured .

documents.title: lack of business space highlighted at parliament
text: a shortage of industrial premises in rugby has been raised in the commons by the town 's conservative mp .
the government was asked by mark pawsey mp , with the local authority currently preparing its local plan , `` how it can ensure adequate land is allocated to the development of business units '' ?

in response , business minister margot james said she recently held a round-table meeting with the minister of state for housing and planning and at a subsequent meeting would `` take into account the needs of businesses in rugby for more space '' .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: nuneaton market trader caught selling e-cig liquid to children
text: a nuneaton market trader was twice caught selling highly addictive e-cig liquid to children during a sting .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: lib-dem mayoral candidate mistakenly billed as labour hopeful
text: a lib-dem mayoral candidate was mistakenly billed in campaign material as standing for labour .
households were sent a leaflet giving `` three reasons to back beverley nielsen for west midlands labour mayor '' .
ms nielsen was actually standing for the liberal democrats .
a campaign spokesman said the leaflet had been created by the local party - the hall green group in birmingham .
author: Alex Homer
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coventry city in line for £ 600k wembley windfall and tickets could rise above 45k
text: coventry city are in line for a potential £ 600,000 windfall from their first appearance at wembley in 30 years and could potentially get even more tickets than the current 45,000 , we can reveal .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: new primary care centre for wellesbourne as part of major housing development
text: a major housing development in wellesbourne will include a brand new primary care centre for the village capable of treating more than 18,000 patients a year .
author: Leamington Courier

documents.title: university announces huge city centre investment
text: a £ 430m investment is being promised by coventry university to develop its campus over the next five years - the largest in the university 's history , it says .
the scheme will see the development of the current civic centre site , a second engineering and computing building , as well as bishop gate student accommodation scheme .
the investments are being showcased at the four-day mipim property show in cannes .

the work will be spread between new builds but also a constant programme of improvements which not only upgrade our existing facilities but will also reflect the changing ways in which students want to work . ''
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: brutal inspiration : why poets are writing about coventry 's ring road
text: the urban landscape has long set literary imaginations on fire - but a ring road may not spring to mind as an obvious source of poetic inspiration .

in coventry , however , the overt orbicular oddness of the ring road and its nine junctions , each elbowing the city , has been celebrated in a collaborative homage to concrete and tarmac by nine poets and nine filmmakers .
author: The Guardian

documents.title: man attacked at rugby club
text: a man sustained cuts when he was hit on the back of the head in an unprovoked attack in rugby , say police .
the 18 year old needed treatment from ambulance staff when he was targeted outside rugby lions rugby club on webb ellis road at about 00:15 on saturday 18 february .

documents.title: district council 's transport chief resigns
text: the man who has been heading up the stratford transport strategy has resigned from his role .
author: Stratford Herald

documents.title: crews still damping down hartshill pub fire
text: crews are still damping down a fire at the malt shovel pub in hartshill which started around 04:05 this morning , the fire service says .
eight engines and about 40 firefighters tackled the blaze at its height .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: creator of stratford 's 'young will ' sculpture has passed away
text: the creator of the 'young will ' shakespeare sculpture in bancroft gardens has passed away .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: new home nightmare for warwickshire couple
text: a warwickshire couple is calling for an investigation after experiencing a catalogue of problems with their new-build home .
steve antonio and andrea fisher say they 've had a number of issues with their property in bishops itchington which they say were caused by it being built too quickly .
they 're calling for the housing ombudsman to investigate .
developer cala homes says it prides itself on customer service and after-care and regrets `` that on this occasion '' it has `` fallen short of our own high standards '' .
we have apologised to miss fisher in person , have been speaking to her regularly and remain fully committed to working with her to resolve matters . ''
author: Richard Williams
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: crews on site at a pub fire in hartshill
text: around 40 firefighters were called to deal with a blaze at the malt shovel pub on grange road in hartshill overnight .
the fire involved both the ground and first floors and warwickshire fire service says it still has staff on site .

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store today ?
text: after a cloudy start , a few brighter intervals are possible ; feeling mild with highs of 14c ( 57f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area here .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

text: welcome to the local live service for coventry and warwickshire on tuesday .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: how was your monday - did you get wembley tickets ?
have a great evening and we 'll catch up again from 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: speedway : campaigners confirm coventry challenge meetings
text: save coventry speedway campaigners have confirmed three challenge meetings have been organised .
a coventry bees team will race at peterborough on sunday , with further matches taking place at wolves on 10 april and poole on 19 april .
the campaigners say they hope further meetings will be agreed at leicester and rye house .
author: Clive Eakin
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: football : coventry 's foley suffers injury blow
text: the coventry city defender kevin foley is facing a spell on the sidelines after suffering a hamstring strain during the weekend 's defeat against bradford city .
but jordan willis has returned to training along with left-back ryan haynes and midfield player gael bigirimana .
[ foley will ] be out for a while , a recurrence of his hamstring injury and when they usually recur it usually comes back a little bit worse and takes a little bit longer to heal . ''
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: watch : tonight and tomorrow 's weather forecast for the west midlands
text: after a bright , sunny day today , here 's how tonight and tomorrow are shaping up .
you can also keep up-to-date with the latest forecast at the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: watch : ghana 's female flying pioneer
text: patricia porter was the first black african to obtain the rotax aircraft engines certificate when the lived in ghana .
she and husband jonathan are now building a full-size plane in their rugby garden to help inspire more women to become engineers .
in 2013 the bbc 's focus on africa programme made this film with patricia at a flight academy in ghana .
author: BBC World

documents.title: university research project nominated for award
text: a research project by coventry university looking at the dynamics of europe 's migration crisis has been shortlisted for an award .
the 'unravelling the mediterranean migration crisis ' ( medmig ) project , led by professor heaven crawley , is up for an accolade in the research impact category of the guardian university awards .
professor crawley 's team reported in november that there were flawed '' and deeply politicised '' assumptions by european governments about the reasons why people moved .

much has been said by politicians about the causes and complexities of the migration crisis , but our study provides the first in-depth analysis of the dynamics of migration in the mediterranean region .
we will continue to work with a range of stakeholders to ensure that it has real impact in influencing policy at the highest levels . ''

documents.title: armed robbery in exhall
text: four men wielding machete-style knives threatened staff at a skip hire company in exhall , say police .
it happened at about 15:55 on friday at hammond skip hire on colliery lane .
cash , company fuel and credit cards were taken along with two cash tins , police believe .
none of the employees were injured .

documents.title: your the splendour of warwick castle
text: this stunning image of warwick castle was sent in by janine king .
you can see this along with other from our viewers on our facebook site .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: police 's sense of smell lands woman in court on drugs charge
text: when the police went to put a rugby woman 's dog back in her home after arresting her over a neighbours ' dispute , they noticed the distinct smell of cannabis .
author: Rugby Advertiser

documents.title: hundreds affected by leamington power cut
text: nearly 1,800 properties are without power in the leamington spa area , says western power distribution .
it 's working on a solution and hopes to have everyone reconnected by around 15:30 .
we apologise we have a # powercut at # leamingtonspa and the surrounding areas # cv32 # cv34 we estimate to restore power by 15:30 .
kay

documents.title: photographic project giving carers a voice
text: a photographic project , documenting the experiences of parents who are carers , is being used to highlight some of the challenges .
coventry mum , fay tomlinson , was the first to take part in the coventry university study , recording images which , she says , reflect the complex needs of her son .
the images are turned into films and viewed by health and social care students .
she said she 'd got involved in the project to `` give carers a voice '' and to `` try and make a difference to students ' learning '' .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crews called to chip shop fire
text: about 15 firefighters tackled a blaze at st george 's plaice chip shop on charter avenue in the canley area of coventry last night .
the fire started , they said , in an industrial fryer at around 21:00 .

documents.title: coventry winter night shelter closes its doors to newcomers in safety dispute as co-ordinator resigns
text: the co-ordinator of the coventry winter night shelter has resigned amid a dispute about volunteer safety .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: marathon challenge ends at stratford racecourse
text: a challenge to run seven marathons in seven days comes to an end today , as john reay hopes to complete the final one at stratford racecourse .
he 's already completed 26 miles at six racecourses across the country raising money for the injured jockeys fund and the great north air ambulance .

documents.title: coventry granted more tickets for wembley final
text: the sky blues could be supported by around 45,000 fans at wembley on 2 april for the efl trophy final against oxford united .
after selling out their initial allocation of 39,000 tickets , the club has been granted another 6,300 .
tickets have been on general sale for the first time this morning .

documents.title: dog fouling shock in holy trinity churchyard
text: shocking revelations of dogs fouling in holy trinity churchyard which owners do n't up have been reported to stratford town council .
author: Stratford Herald

documents.title: student takes strawberry research to parliament
text: a phd student from coventry is presenting bioscience research to a panel of politicians at parliament today as part of the stem for britain competition .
thomas adams , 23 , will present his work about red core disease in strawberries under the scheme that seeks to support and promote britain 's early-career research scientists .
the parliamentary and scientific committee runs the event in collaboration with scientific institutions , including warwick manufacturing group .

documents.title: first game defeat for new coventry manager
text: the sky blues ' first team squad can expect some hard work on the training ground ahead of tomorrow night 's match at home to southend .
after losing the first match of his second spell in charge of the city in .
a 2-0 defeat against bradford city , manager mark robins said the team needed to do some work and make sure their performance got better .
we have ten games left now and this is another game ticked off where we have n't got three points .
this is one of those instances where we have to have a go and we have to respond . ''
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: flying pioneer builds aircraft to inspire others
text: a rugby couple building a full-size plane in their back garden are taking their knowledge into schools to inspire girls to become engineers .
it has been more than five years since patricia porter wandered on to her now-husband jonathan 's airfield in ghana and asked for a job .
she went on to become the first woman in ghana to gain the national civilian pilots licence .
author: Richard Williams
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: warning after suspected dog poisoning in nuneaton
text: investigations are under way after a dog was believed to have been poisoned by food left on a popular green space in nuneaton .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: fa vase dreams still alive for coleshill town
text: coleshill town 's wembley dream is still alive despite suffering a 2-1 defeat in their fa vase semi-final first leg at home to south shields .
coleshill will go to the north east on saturday for the second leg and manager simon lyons said he could n't fault his team 's efforts .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: traveller site plan set for green light
text: a temporary traveller site in tanworth-in-arden is set to be made permanent .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: wembley final tickets on general sale
text: tickets for coventry 's efl trophy final at wembley go on general sale at 09:00 .
there are about 7,000 tickets left of the club 's allocation for the match against oxford united on april 2 .
the club 's asking fans to buy tickets online or over the phone after delays at the butts park arena ticket office when tickets initially went on sale to season ticket-holders .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: video : what 's the weather got in store ?
text: after a bright and sunny start , some cloud moving in with highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
